---
title: "Food Graph"
author: "Erik Rodriguez"
subtitle: "Just an example of working with a .qmd file"
date: "2023-11-08"
---


# MPG vs Horsepower

This is a graph about food:


::: {.cell .column-margin}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(ggplot2)
mtcars2 <- mtcars
mtcars2$am <- factor(
  mtcars$am, labels = c('chocolate', 'vanilla')
)
ggplot(mtcars2, aes(hp, mpg, color = am)) +
  geom_point() + geom_smooth() +
  theme(legend.position = 'bottom')
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![Different kinds of food.](index_files/figure-html/food-margin-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Showing it bigger:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(ggplot2)
mtcars2 <- mtcars
mtcars2$am <- factor(
  mtcars$am, labels = c('chocolate', 'vanilla')
)
ggplot(mtcars2, aes(hp, mpg, color = am)) +
  geom_point() + geom_smooth() +
  theme(legend.position = 'bottom')
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
`geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula = 'y ~ x'
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::
